Sequence Information.Peptide Name: cBD-1 (chinchilla beta-defensin-1, natural AMPs; 3S=S, UCSS1a; rodents, mammals; animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (48.53%) tocBD103R: 14%, L=G: 11%.  GRAVY: 0.22; Mol Wt:  7520.186; mol formula:  C333H550N100O81S8; mol ex coeff:  3355.Activity: active against bacteria E. coli NTHI 86-028NP, S. pneumoniae type 14, and M. catarrhalis 1857, and the fungus C. albicans. All essentially killed at 20 ug/ml. Non-standard assay: killing effect: incubated 1 h followed by plating to detect survival bacteria.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: his-tagged recombinant peptide was expressed and purified via affinity chromatography and used for activity test.
Literature Information.Author: Harris RH, Wilk D, Bevins CL, Munson RS Jr, Bakaletz LO. 2004
Literature Information.Title: Identification and characterization of a mucosal antimicrobial peptide expressed by the chinchilla (Chinchilla lanigera) airway.
